senses.de: complete or do what is expected, necessary or promised
senses.ex: I have a dream, and I will fulfil it no matter what.

Tips.title: Expectation Fulfillment
Tips.description: Relates to completing tasks or achieving goals that are anticipated by oneself or others.
Tips.example: He studied hard to fulfil the expectations of his parents.

Tips.title: Commitment Important
Tips.description: Stresses the importance of honoring commitments or promises in professional and personal contexts.
Tips.example: They volunteered to fulfil their pledge to the charity.

senses.de: to satisfy a condition or obey a law
senses.ex: The company has failed to fulfil its legal obligations.

Tips.title: Legal Satisfaction
Tips.description: In legal contexts, implying the proper completion of legal agreements or duties.
Tips.example: The terms were difficult, but she managed to fulfil the contract's conditions.

Tips.title: Conditions Compliance
Tips.description: Highlights the necessity to meet specific standards or criteria set by regulations or agreements.
Tips.example: The building project will fulfil all the specified safety criteria.

senses.de: to develop the full qualities or potential of somebody
senses.ex: Every parent wants their child to fulfil their potential.

Tips.title: Potential Maximization
Tips.description: Focuses on the growth or development to one's full capabilities or possibilities.
Tips.example: Through hard work, she was able to fulfil her intellectual capabilities.

Tips.title: Personal Growth
Tips.description: Often used in the context of personal development and the realization of one’s abilities.
Tips.example: Mentorship programs help young people fulfil their talents.

senses.de: to make (someone) satisfied or happy, by doing or providing what is desired or needed
senses.ex: The new job did not fulfil his hopes.

Tips.title: Desire Achievement
Tips.description: Indicates that someone's strong wishes or ambitions are being met or satisfied.
Tips.example: After years of hard work, he was able to fulfil his lifelong dream of traveling the world.

Tips.title: Emotional Satisfaction
Tips.description: Conveys the emotional aspect of meeting one's aspirations or needs, leading to contentment.
Tips.example: Her support did much to fulfil his need for friendship.

Abide by.wordDefinition:
Abide by means to follow or adhere to rules, laws or agreements. It is applicable when you are expected to comply with certain rules or regulations.

For example, if you are playing a game, you need to abide by its rules.

Abide by means to follow rules, while fulfil means to complete a task or promise.

Accomplish.wordDefinition:
Accomplish means to complete a task or goal successfully. This typically involves achieving something tangible, like finishing a project or winning a competition.

Example: I accomplished my goal of running a mile in under 10 minutes.

Accomplish is used when you successfully complete a tangible goal, while "fulfill" is used when you satisfy an expectation or achieve something intangible.

Achieve.wordDefinition:
Achieve means to successfully reach a goal or accomplish something that has been worked towards. It suggests having to overcome obstacles or difficulties along the way.

For example, one can achieve a high grade on a difficult test by studying hard and overcoming obstacles, but one can fulfil a promise by following through with what was expected or promised.

Complete.wordDefinition:
Complete means to finish something or bring it to an end. For example, if you complete your homework, it means you have finished all the required tasks.

Complete is used when referring to finishing a task or a goal, while fulfil is used when referring to satisfying someone's expectations or requirements.

Execute.wordDefinition:
Execute means to carry out a plan or order, or to perform a task or duty.

For example, a military officer might execute a tactical operation, while a student might fulfill the requirements of a course.

Execute is associated with performing specific actions, while fulfill is associated with meeting expectations or requirements.

Meet.wordDefinition:
Meet refers to a basic level of expectation or obligation being satisfied, while fulfil means to go beyond the basic level and exceed expectations.

For example, if a student completes all the required assignments for a class, they have met the minimum expectations. If they also participate in class discussions and earn a high grade, they have fulfilled expectations.

Meet describes meeting basic requirements or responsibilities, while fulfil describes exceeding them.

Realize.wordDefinition:
Realize means to become aware of something or to make something real. It refers to a sudden understanding or recognition of something previously unknown or unrealized.

For example, if you suddenly understand a difficult math problem, you could say you realized the solution.

In short, "fulfill" is about completing a task or goal, whereas realize is about understanding something that may not have been recognized before.

Satisfy.wordDefinition:
Satisfy means to meet a need or desire, or to make someone happy or content.

It is often used in relation to personal satisfaction or enjoyment. For example, one can satisfy a craving for chocolate, or satisfy their curiosity about a particular topic.

Fulfil is more focused on meeting requirements or obligations, while satisfy is more focused on meeting personal needs or desires.

videos.Text: And while meditating under a bodhi tree, the rest of the answer came to him. All of life abounds with suffering. It's caused by selfish craving for one's own fulfillment at the expense of others. Following an eight-step plan can teach us to reduce that craving, and thus reduce the suffering.

quotes.Text: I'm fulfilled in what I do. I never thought that a lot of money or fine clothes - the finer things of life - would make you happy. My concept of happiness is to be filled in a spiritual sense.
quotes.Title: American Activist
quotes.Name: Coretta Scott King

quotes.Text: Love alone is capable of uniting living beings in such a way as to complete and fulfill them, for it alone takes them and joins them by what is deepest in themselves.
quotes.Title: French Philosopher
quotes.Name: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin

quotes.Text: You were not created to just get by with an average, unrewarding, or unfulfilling life. God created you to leave your mark on this generation.
quotes.Title: American Clergyman
quotes.Name: Joel Osteen

quotes.Text: Honestly, it's what the world's all about and what life's all about - fulfillment and making people's lives better.
quotes.Title: American Athlete
quotes.Name: Pat McAfee

quotes.Text: The game is my wife. It demands loyalty and responsibility, and it gives me back fulfillment and peace.
quotes.Title: American Basketball Player
quotes.Name: Michael Jordan

quotes.Text: You can't tell what's going to fulfill you in different stages in your life.
quotes.Title: English Actress
quotes.Name: Andrea Riseborough

quotes.Text: Pursuing your passion is fulfilling and leads to financial freedom.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Robert G. Allen

quotes.Text: I try to fulfill my role and my responsibility as much as I can.
quotes.Title: American Basketball Player
quotes.Name: Jabari Parker

quotes.Text: The people respect and believe in men who fulfill their duty.
quotes.Title: Statesman
quotes.Name: Fidel Castro

quotes.Text: I want to live a fulfilling life.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Amy Purdy
